comment: I took him a couple semesters ago and it was one of the worst decisions Of my life. I desperately needed hope at the end, but because he took away an entire project grade at the END of the semester I I got a C. A 10 page paper was given, no rubric Vague instructions, Ive never had a teacher so unprofessional that they take away an important grade
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Don't take him if you want to learn anything. Professor Gregory is rude, immature, and unprofessional. I'm not sure how he has gotten so many good reviews thus far, but I wasted a semester with him. The com department at KSU is filled with numerous awesome professors; however, he is not one of them...
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Two semesters ago, I had Mr. G for & liked his class. I took him again (for a different class) this semester, & it was possibly the worst class I have taken in 4 years of college. He's too scattered, VERY unprofessional, & possibly the most problematic prof I have ever had to the point where every day was a new confrontation with another student.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Mr. G's class started out fun, but got old very quick. Out of the entire semester, we did maybe 20% of the things we were supposed to because he was never able to form a cohesive thought & teach for more than 5 minutes without going into a tangent that lasted for literally 45 minutes. He quickly became the worst professor I've ever had.

Mr. G is one of the best Prof. I've had a KSU. You are graded on 4 things: participation (try to stand out a little in class), group presentation (he will take the time to look at your project before you present and help make corrections), a midterm and a final. He is always willing to talk and help after class, and he is just a great teacher!

Worse professor I've ever had. I'd take him as a last resort because his classes are manageable and he cares about making sure everyone gets an A. However, he goes off on tangents that don't relate to the class and there's a group project. Midterm, Attendance, Group Presentation, and Final are the only grades.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests? Not many--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Mr. G is very outgoing and loves teaching. Many would call him scatter brained but when students actually pay attention hes not. Most students are busy on Facebook or texting to learn what hes trying to teach. He has an excellent teaching method that will prepare any communication student the fundamentals of their major and future careers.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS--Amazing lectures

comment: One of the funnest classes I  have taken at ksu, I hope he teaches other classes.

The class is really simple. If you're a COM major or interest, you may like Mr. G's scatterbrained approach to teaching this course. He goes off topic, but always comes back to the original point. Sometimes you'll have to remind him. Participation isn't mandatory. However, it does make the class go by faster.
He's a nice guy
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Professor G is the best professor I've had at KSU. Let me start by saying that he is definitely not for everyone, but if you are nerdy and like movies, he is the right professor for you. Not a very traditional classroom setting, but he keeps it fun and loves for people to engage with him. Easy A if you just participate and don't complain!

Mr. G is not for everyone. He is pretty scatter brained and gets easily off topic. Everything I learned I pretty much taught myself while studying for the midterm and final. His test are super easy and he is a pretty funny guy. So at least he is an easy A. You'll just never want to go to class and you can only miss 2.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: He is probably one of the oddest teachers I've had. He doesn't require much but attendance is mandatory. He has one midterm, a group project, and a final. He never tells you your grade until the very last second. His lectures are okay but he does get off topic. Pick a good group or you will be left doing all the work yourself.

I took Mr. G for both 2230 and 4444. He is hands down one of the best profs I've had at KSU! He truly cares about his students and gives guidance on papers and projects. He can be scatterbrained, but gives entertaining lectures and makes sure you know the information. You must be in class to pass. His assignments and tests aren't hard. Take him!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: If you're interested in media and pop culture, you'll enjoy his class. I loved it. He doesn't have slides- but he repeats himself and isn't that hard to follow. If he says WID, it's on the test. Grade is 2 tests, attendance, and an easy group project. His tests are easy if you take notes and come to class every day. Can't wait to take him for 4444!

He has no knowledge of a scheduled class time .Every test we had,  wouldn't leave until atleast an hour late. He talks whole time and waits until the last 15 mins to give out the test. If you want to pass, you have to stay after to finish, really messes you up if you have classes after. The final, had to stay 3 hours after "scheduled final time"

Mr. G is not only the coolest professor I have had but also the most entertaining. He is incredibly passionate about communications and his film class (COM 4444). I took both classes in the same semester & it was the best decision I ever made. I am your typical average student and made As in both the classes. Sign up & show up, you wont regret it!

If you struggle with paying attention in class, this class is not the one for you. He was all over the place in his lectures and did not make much sense which makes things difficult when you only have four grades in the class. I was able to get by with the help of my classmates but honestly did not take anything away from the course itself.

Write down what he says if you want an A even though most of the things he says are not related to communications AT ALL. You need to be a very patient person if you want to take this class. You won't learn anything in class, but class is mandatory and it is -5pts every class you miss. Actual test question: What is the color I said on 12/4...

Great professor. Went off on unrelated tangents, which is frustrating for those just there to learn, but made for an interesting class. There's one video project, and the grade is made up of a paper, midterm, final, and participation points.  Do assignments early. Watch Citizen Kane. Read the textbook.

One video project (group or solo), two tests (midterm and final), and one semester-long assignment where you choose 10 movies to watch on your own time and analyze them, one page each. ***Get started on this assignment early in the semester.*** It can be fun and easy that way, procrastination leads to chaos. Gregory is excellent, you'll love him.

Gregory is one of the best professors I've ever had. He is a cool super nerd, and makes class awesome and funny. Respectable guy. Might stray off-topic at times. He's more than willing to help you. For your own sake, PARTICIPATE: ask questionsadd commentarydon't be a brick wall, he'll appreciate that AND you get to talk with an amazing person.
Great at handling a bunch of wild students.  He is very funny and the grading was a breeze.  I did almost nothing and got an A.  The best COM class i've taken so far.

Mr. G was hands down the best professor that I've taken at KSU. He is such a sweet man and really cares about your grade. He is pretty easy, all you have to do is write it down when he tells you write it down! Of course you have to study, but overall he tries to help any way he can. Take him!

Mr G is the best teacher at Kennesaw State University, hands down. Also, this rating is from a real person, not an anonymous Internet user. Also also, Rate My Professors is an extremely useful Internet site, and its reviews are very helpful to me, a real person, as they represent a true cross-section of Mr. Gregory's students. :-)

Mr. G is great.  I worried at the beginning of class because he's unconventional, but he's always on your side.  If he tells you to WIT ("write it down"), then you'd better WIT because it's going to be on a test.  He's not a pushover, and he's not going to just "give" you a grade - you have to earn it, but he really wants you to succeed. Take him.

Mr. G was the most interesting and inspirational professor I've had. He's fun and keeps the 3 hr class interesting. If you reach out to him, he helps you. When he strays from the lecture he gives advice in your future profession from his own experiences. I respect how down to earth he is. He's the man! There is nothing negative to say.

This man is a genius. He his hilarious and knows his craft. There is real passion in what he teaches you, and every course I've taken with him has been completely applicable to life skills. If you are willing to learn, he will better your career in addition to your educational experience. Absolutely inspiring.

Mr. G was probably one of my favorite professors at Kennesaw. Sure, his lectures are not always "to the book" and he tends to stray off topic from time to time, but what he is really teaching is a way to think differently about subject matter that you may have thought of before. Great professor. Loves what he does, and it shows.
If you like movies and are want to take a unique class this is it. The lectures are fun, he uses a lot of sci fihorror films as well as many others to explain the information in the book.

Of course, as it is with any course much of what I took away fell upon my efforts and personal goals for taking the course. You will learn about Mass COM and yes there are the rabbit trails of his personal favorites but at least it breaks up the lecture hypnotism students often face. Be respectful and ready to work in a group. Mr. G is fair and sup

I really enjoyed taking this class! Sure, you have your occasional lectures of The Walking Dead, but we discussed it from a different perspective.  Little hints of production talk in this class.  MAKE SURE YOU COME TO CLASS! If you do, he is awesome.  If not, the class will laugh and make fun of you.

I learned nothing about mass communication. I learned a lot about memes, Star Wars, Dragon-Con and the WAlking Dead. Do not take this class if you want to actually learn a single thing. DO take if you want an Easy A.

Oh lord. Mr. G, while he is nice and personable, can become very annoying. Be prepared to learn nothing but still get an easy A. He goes on and on about random things that have nothing to do with the class. Don't buy the book; I'm sure he'll tell you that about 1000 times.

THE easiest teacher I've ever had. That being said, I learned almost nothing. Gregory is funny, likes to talk about social media, and is mostly friendly. There are 2 tests and a final project. During presentations, he interrupts CONSTANTLY to add his own thoughts. Take for an easy A, but beware that you WILL get annoyed with him.

If you really want to learn, take someone else. If you want an easy A, take Mr. G. I didn't buy the book, got an A. The few things he wants you to know, he will repeat a LOT, so you won't miss anything. Drawbacks are a lot of time wasted while he babbles about last night's Walking Dead or Game of Thrones. No papers, just an easy group project.

If you can handle is meaningly talk everyday, you can make and easy A. DO NOT BUY THE BOOK! his power points cover everything. He will only give you work to do if someone complains whether they are in your class or not. Easy A or B. I wouldn't recommend him because of his talking about non-sense feature. lol

Missed questions on midterm that he admitted he didn't cover. Who does that and thinks its ok?  Haven't learned a thing about tv/film but I've learned A LOT about Dragoncon & Star Wars which are 2 things I didn't pay my $$ to hear discussed EVERY class. He's an easy A if you can take his rants, him being unorganized & constant tardiness to class.

Couldn't wait to take this class. I must say if you can take someone else please avoid him. He rambles on about Star Wars and other nonsense. Now halfway into the semester and we've learned NOTHING (no exaggeration). Took 3 weeks to get syllabus & schedule.  He's always late and VERY unorganized.  OMG what a waste of my hard earned money.

If you want an easy class this is it. Don't buy the book. I was disappointed because I was interested in film, but I didn't learn much. This was a  3 hour class with about an hour of actual material, the rest of it is him trying too hard to be funny, or going off tangent. He is very disorganized, but this class can occasionally be fun.

I think this is the easiest class I've ever taken. 2 minimum effort presentations and 2 tests (midterm and final) that he goes over the class before the test. The off-topic conversations can be fun but near the end it gets very annoying. He'll talk about the same random stuff and presentations get pushed back days or weeks.

This is the second class I've taken with Mr. G. His teaching style takes getting used to because it's very casual, but he's worth taking! He loves to discuss the media in every aspect, from memes to movies to apps. He tells you exactly what to write down and does reviews for the exams. He's just great!

MR. G IS THE MAN! If you are saying he is unprepared at TIMES? Sure. But he knows it and isn't going to bust your chops. He relates well with his students and keeps the class entertaining. If you want information about film a textbook CANT teach you and are truly passionate about film. G-Money all day, every day.

Don't buy the book. Desire for easy route? Take him. However, he never gives out grades throughout the semester so when u get your final grade & expected an A/B, don't be surprised when he gives u a B/C instead. The midterm and finals are the same but there will be bs ques. on the finals. You'll end up studying  for material that he won't include.

Mr. G is an easy teacher and knows he's an easy teacher. If you come to class and pay attention (especially when he says "write it down, write it down"), you'll be just fine. Anyone who complains about him obviously didn't make ANY effort in his his class. How can you get a good grade if you don't make any effort? Mr. G is awesome!

Mr. G is *Eccentric.* He relies on people to bring their own knowledge of communication topics/history/culture/etc. into his class  in order to have meaning discussions(i.e. this is college).  If you are a person who relies heavily on a syllabus & fixed time-frames, this class is not for you. If you are more flexible, sit back and enjoy the ride.

Professor G is the man.  His classes are really fun and informative.  This class could have been taught by someone very dry so his insight and humor are very welcome.  As far as getting a good grade show up, pay attention, study before the tests and you'll get an "A".  Highly recommended.

Mr. Gregory is a great person and a great teacher, but he is not for everyone. he's a big nerd and dragon*con fan and really loves film. it's easy to get an A if you take notes on the things he says in class and actually study before taking the tests. he was a little unclear about the paper we had to do, so i hope he's more clear in the future.

He does not teach anything Yet he expects you to know what to make your group presentations about. His grading is inaccurate. Even though it is a very easy class and you do all of your work, he will grade you however he pleases. I did not learn absolutely anything in his class. He picks favorites and everyone else is w/e. He isnt funny justannoying

This is the most annoying class I ever took. At the beginning of the semester it looked like it was going to be lots of fun but Mr. G is as goofy as he is funny. Even though it's an easy A, you will not get timely feedback as far as grades... very disorganized teaching and I keep asking why we bought a workbook we never used!

I found professor "G" to be extremely unorganized, verbose, and obnoxious. There were times I liked him...but that was fleeting. He had only put one grade up before we took the final (the only test he didn't have to grade, the computer did). He is an easy A, but not worth the anguish he will cause you.
Easy professor, doesn't ask for much. Just write down what he tells you to write down and participate. I was in the 4 week class and All we had was 2 tests and a presentation.

Great teacher, is alot of fun and a huge nerd. My only problem is that he never graded anything on time. Went into the final blind, not knowing where I stood. Still made a B but it was fun. Didn't learn much though
Such an easy class! You have a midterm, final, and 2 group projects that take VERY little time if you split up the work between group members. Easiest and least time consuming class I've ever taken..

Pretty fun and interesting teacher. He mixes up the class with LOTS of humor. There are two presentations, one of which he takes pretty seriously. Attendance is pretty mandatory. It's taken by group and if you do not communicate with the group leader, it can cost points! Overall, enjoyed the class!

Mr. G. is a funny guy.  Is the easiest class I have taken while at KSU - but attndance matters and will hurt you if you don't show up.  2 exams and 2 projects.  only complaint is he gets off topic and can ramble alot - could probably teach the class in 20 minutes if he didn't get off subject so much.
Funny guy. Tries to keep things interesting. Bases a lot on group activities so pick a good group leader. Only 2 tests and a final. If possible, take him.

Easiest class ever! I made an A and the tests were super easy if you paid attention. I had roommates who did poorly but that is because they never came to class or paid attention. As long as your group keeps coming to class and doing the projects, getting a high grade is a piece of cake.

This professor came to class every day unorganized and only talked about things related to his life. He talked about dragon con and movies he liked. I found this class to be a waste of my time and very useless. He needs to stick to the material. He expects us to make 100's on tests when he doesn't even give us the information to prepare.

To be honest, this class was way too easy. I'm sure everyone got at least a B in my class. The tests are so easy and we spent only two days in the entire semester learning "test" material. Attendance is taken but is not really mandatory. Go to the review sessions before tests and you will be fine.
He's a hilarious guy and an awesome teacher, but he's way too easy for a college level class. The tests were laughably easy. Come to class, pay attention, and you'll make an A.

I really enjoyed this class. If you have the chance to have him as a teacher, do it. You won't be disappointed! It is because of Mr. G that I want to be a communications major now. If you are willing to put in a little extra time become a group leader, it will really help you out (unless you are a slacker).
This class is such a joke. Mr. G is super easy, but very disorganized. It's an easy A if you don't mind the disorganization.

Mr. Gregory, or Mr.G as we called him, is a great teacher! Keeps everything really simple and easy to remember. If you do poorly in this class it's because you never went to class. and believe me you wont hate going to this class. Fun and exciting :)

Ridiculously easy professor and class, talks about dragon con and random junk and teaches so little that failing this class means your an embarrassingly dumb student.hes funny and odd and EASY, projects are easy, tests are a joke and the class is an easy GPA booster. I say everyone should take it.

Easiest class I have ever taken!! Do not buy the workbook it is a waste of money. You will not use it! If your a communication major do not take this class because you will not learn anything you need to know for higher classes. If you do not get an A you should just drop out of school.
funniest and easiest teacher ever. if you dont get an A then there is no hope for you lol.
